responsibilities: Design and implement modular AI agents using large language models (LLMs) to automate and optimize workflows.
Deploy and maintain end-to-end AI workflows in cloud environments ensuring performance.
Build multi-agent systems and develop RAG pipelines using vector databases.
Fine-tune LLMs with frameworks and tools to create domain-adapted models.
Integrate knowledge graphs into agent pipelines.
Implement caching strategies using semantic caching to enhance performance.
Create scalable backend services and prototype user interfaces.
Monitor and evaluate performance using feedback loops and observability tools.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop AI systems.
Stay updated on cloud platforms and AI/ML technologies.
required_skills: Python development skills including API and service integration.
Experience with LLM APIs, agent frameworks, and prompt engineering.
Knowledge of deploying AI applications using Docker and cloud infrastructure.
RAG pipelines and vector databases skills.
Experience fine-tuning LLMs using PyTorch and related tools.
Familiarity with knowledge graphs and associated databases.
Frontend prototyping skills using tools like Streamlit or Gradio.
MLOps practices knowledge and CI/CD workflows.
Cloud deployment experience in Azure, AWS, or GCP.
Understanding of caching strategies and embedding-based similarity.
preferred_skills: Knowledge of distributed training tools like DeepSpeed.
Experience with Neo4j, AWS Neptune for knowledge graph.
Working knowledge of semantic caching tools.
education_requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Technology (B.Tech) or Master of Computer Applications (MCA); MS in similar field preferred.
experience_required: 7-10 years in AI/ML domain, with 2+ years on LLMs or applied NLP.

matching_criteria.skill: Python development skills including API and service integration
LLM APIs and agent frameworks experience
Knowledge graphs and vector database expertise
